title: As SJC mulls involvement in public defender work stoppage, here’s where things stand
author: Ross Cristantiello
bullets: Over 900 defendants in Massachusetts remain without representation despite a recent pay raise for public defenders.
The Supreme Judicial Court is considering whether judges can grant temporary pay raises to court-appointed attorneys.
The SJC expressed hesitancy about intervening, citing concerns over separation of powers and legislative budget priorities.

title: Reese Witherspoon visits Boston bookstore
author: Madison Lucchesi
bullets: Reese Witherspoon signed copies of her novel 'Gone Before Goodbye' at Beacon Hill Books and Cafe in Boston.
Witherspoon discussed her book at Harvard Business School, reflecting on 'Legally Blonde' and her book club.
Her book 'Gone Before Goodbye', co-authored by Harlan Coben, is a New York Times bestselling thriller.

title: GOP lawmakers pushing Healey for info on aide arrested in cocaine bust
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Republican lawmakers question Gov. Maura Healey's vetting process after aide LaMar Cook's arrest for cocaine trafficking.
Cook, former deputy director in Healey's office, was arrested for allegedly trafficking cocaine to a state office building.
GOP contenders call for investigation into Healey's hiring practices, citing Cook's past criminal charges as overlooked.

title: 2 teens killed in New Bedford crash identified
author: Madison Lucchesi
bullets: Gabriel Bertolino Siqueira, 17, and Anne Urbanski Santos De Carvalho, 15, were killed in a New Bedford crash on Route 140.
The crash occurred around 2 a.m. Saturday; a gray 2019 Honda Civic was found off-road in a wooded area.
An 18-year-old Dartmouth man driving the vehicle was hospitalized with non-life-threatening injuries; investigation is ongoing.

title: BPD releases multiple photos of baseball-capped commercial burglary suspect
author: Madison Lucchesi
bullets: Boston police seek public's help identifying a man involved in downtown commercial burglaries since August 21.
Suspect reportedly used pry tool to access businesses, stealing credit cards, cash, and electronics including camera equipment.
Photos of suspect released; info can be reported to Boston police at 617-343-4571.

title: Report: Mike Vrabel’s former team was ‘unwilling’ to trade with Patriots
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Tennessee Titans reportedly refused to trade with the New England Patriots due to owner Amy Adams Strunk's reluctance.
Former Titans coach Mike Vrabel was fired in 2023, affecting relations between Titans and Vrabel's new team, the Patriots.
Titans, currently 1-8, were not interested in helping Vrabel's new team despite Patricia's interest in certain players.

title: Following a career night, Josh Minott isn’t taking his starting role for granted
author: Aidan Buchanan
bullets: Josh Minott scores a career-high 21 points in the Celtics' 136-107 win against the Washington Wizards.
After three seasons with the Timberwolves, Minott earns a starting role, averaging 9.1 points in 22.5 minutes per game.
Minott's competitiveness and defensive prowess impress teammates and contribute to Celtics' recent success.

title: Are the New England Patriots back? Hereâ€™s what 200 readers said.
author: Frances Klemm
bullets: Boston.com readers are divided on Patriots' success; 43% vote 'yes', 44% say 'too early to tell'.
Quarterback Drake Maye and coach Mike Vrabel praised for Patriots' performance amidst six-game winning streak.
Skeptical fans point to weak opponents and upcoming Tampa Bay game as a true test of team's progress.

title: Questions swirl after bus aide allegedly assaults autistic student from Cambridge
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: Cambridge family's autistic son allegedly assaulted by bus aide, incident caught on video, aide placed on leave by NRT.
Department of Children and Families investigating, Cambridge Public Schools prohibited aide from transporting any local children.
Family removed son from NRT transportation, schools emphasizes student safety and demands high care standards from vendors.

title: Patriots owner Robert Kraft named a semifinalist for 2026 Pro Football Hall of Fame Class
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Robert Kraft, owner of the New England Patriots, is a semifinalist for the Pro Football Hall of Fame's 2026 class.
Kraft, 84, has been considered 13 times but never advanced past the semifinal round in the contributor category.
Kraft is among nine semifinalists including Bud Adams and Art Rooney Jr.; finalists announced in February, induction in August.
